Dear Ms. Dunn:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
01/12/22023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Kari Muntean, at 734-395-0920 .
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk
Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
Rule 113. An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(b) A true copy of verification of education from an accredited college or
university where minimum education requirements are specified by rule.
One of eight new employee files reviewed did not contain verification of high
s chool diploma or GED.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
Rule 113. An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to employment from
persons unrelated to the employee and which are less than 12 months
old.
Two of eight new employee files reviewed were missing references, one
contained only two, and one contained only one of the three required
r eferences.
2.) The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance will all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements.

Description of Agency Walk Through:
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on 01/12/2023. The
facility was found to be clean, neat, and appropriate. Bedrooms had clean sheets,
pillows, and comforters. Kitchen observed to have menu posted, plenty of food, and
very clean.
Staff and Youth Interviews:
Staff reported feeling supported by supervisor, and upper management. They said the
facility’s main goal is ensuring the safety and well-being of the youths and the
administration strives at ensuring all the youths needs are being met. Staff indicated
they receive ample training that has been very beneficial in assisting them in caring
for all the youths. Youths interviewed reported all their needs are being met and
expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on
their regular license.
